other_tests.findings: Inappropriately normal or low urinary calcium excretion.
other_tests.changes_over_time: On the first occasion, 1.43 mmol; two months later, 3.43 mmol.

other_tests.findings: 0.7 x 0.4 cm hypoechoic area in the left lower neck, consistent with a left inferior parathyroid adenoma.
No persistent area of increased uptake consistent with an enlarged parathyroid gland.
Diffusely increased uptake in the sternum and spine, suggestive of hyperparathyroid bone disease.
Mild osteopenia of the lumbar spine (T score, -1.05).

other_tests.procedure_name: Selective angiogram of the neck with venous sampling
other_tests.findings: Moderate elevation in the level of PTH in the thyroid venous drainage in the absence of definitive angiographic evidence for a parathyroid adenoma.
Serum calcium concentration of 2.63 mmol/liter with a concomitant intact PTH level of 39 pg/ml.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Post-surgery serum calcium level decreased to 2.38 mmol/liter with intact PTH at 32.5 pg/ml.

other_tests.findings: Serum total calcium concentration increased to 2.68 mmol/liter with an intact PTH level of 35 pg/ml.
